body: should it be size _and_ number? size obviously needs to be possible to limit by the admin, but number of versions seems a bit arbitrary. especially when i have a text document which i change often, it would be annoying to have it limited in that way.

the admin can either keep it unlimited or define a max size _or_ number of versions.

i think both can be useful. personally i prefer a limit by number of versions (on my home server). this makes it easy to know "ok, i can always access the latest n versions". i don't care about a few mb more or less. i just want that it is predictable and don't create a infinite number of version.

limit by size can mean everything from no version to many versions, depending on the file size. it is much harder to know how many versions will be available, when a old version will be deleted and even how many old versions will be deleted if i save my new version. still this option can be useful for admins of large installations to know/define exactly how much space will be used for versions.

at the moment i would prefer to have both options because they serve different use cases as described above. but i'm always open for better solutions. what would be your suggestion?

the problem is that â»number of versionsâ« isnâ€™t predictable at all. you donâ€™t remember how often you save a document (or how often it gets autosaved). if you do it often and have a limit of 50 versions (or other arbitrary number) you might not even be able to go back to the day before yesterday.

instead, what about limit by age? that way you can say to expire versions older than a month, which is much more predictable.

i also thought about the different options a bit. i think it is not easy to come to a conclusion since there are always pro and contra arguments.

your argument abut "numbers of versions" is correct but the same is true for the size option. it is also not predictable when you will hit the size limit. if the last version of your document gets a lot larger than the previous versions than it can even happen that (almost) all old versions are gone.

i like the idea of the "limit by age" but also here you could argue that it is bad if i lose important versions just because the draft of a document takes a few months for example.

there are many use cases for which different ways to expire old versions fits best. currently i use a select box to allow the user to select the two options. so it is nothing which clutters the interface if there is one more option or not. of course i would like to avoid to have a long and confusing list of options. but i think it is fine to provide 2 or 3 options to the admin in the select box to choose the way which fits best his users and his deployment. at the moment i would tend to add your "limit by age" option as a third one. then we would have a nice set of time, size and number limit which should cover all possible use cases.
